page.lettertext:
fol.276r
Belgia: 1590: Sep
t
Belgia 1590 21 Sep
t
to my L Trea
s
May yt please yo
r
good L. to adv
r
tise her
Hig
nes
that according
to the motion of her l
res
of
e 10
th
of this moneth, w
ch
I have
deliv
r
ed to
e
g
na
l states
, the sending of forces into the ennemyes
countrey hath bin put in consultation aswell in theyr assembly as
in
e
Councel of state
. And for the reasons alleaged in her Hig
nes
letters, w
ch
I accompanied as I was willed w
th
oth
r
consyderations
yt is fully resolved that the chiefest of theyr forces shall go
p
nt
ly for
Brabant
if
Co. Maurice
& oth
r
principall
sons
w
ch
are now at
e siege of Hemart &
Heel
shall thinke yt
expedient. To this effect they have written to Co. Maurice
& I have also sent him her Ma
tyes
l
res
. It was in
deliberac
o
n among th
e
to send theyr forces into
Flandres
but they finde yt full of danger & difficulty for many
[respect
], especially for want of a commodious descent
for theyr forces, a safe retrait, & a convenient meanes
to transport theyr horse & great artillerie. w
ch
will also
be subject to excessive charges & may ill be spared at
this present: for I can say upon knowledge that they have
bin forced to disbourse extraordinarely above 100000 fl
o
in theyr late exploit before
Nieumeghen
, upon retourne of
Aunswere from Co. Maurice I think
e states themselves
will certify her Hig
nes
how they purpose to employ theyr force
against
e ennemy. 2 daies past I Rxd yo
r
L. letter
of
e 7 of this moneth by old
M
r
Allen
. Upon
e questions
there proposed about the enterprise of
Donkerk
I have
confered w
th
e
ty that made
e ouverture unto mee, whose
ticular answears together w
th
the questions I have written
a
te & sent yo
r
L. heerinclosed. Moreover unto that w
ch
her
Ma
ty
doth demand, wheth
r
this practise upon Donkerk may
bee well effected by such oth
r
new forces as her Ma
ty
may
send into some
te of Flandres: it is aunswered by the
ty
that yf yt bee ment by
Oostend
; the site of that place
is not
e best for that purpose, because yt is too long a
march from thense, to Donkerk by land being 9 leagues, and
by water they cannot come forth but by spetiall windes:
w
th
all yt is to bee feared that
e sending of new forces into
those quarters w
th
out a very great likeliehood in the
ennemyes opinion that they are to bee employed in some oth
r
spetiall action will move the neibour townes to a great
suspition, & make them so carefull in providing for the woorst
fol.276v
Belgia: 1590 Sep
t
.
as they will hardly bee intrapped. In w
ch
regard hee thought
t
the embarking of men at
Dover
would bee nothing so subject
to such inconvenience as on this syd
e seas.
Raynold Peeterson
of
Horne
is now in Horne. From whence I will eith
r
send for him
hether or
cure his aunswere to the questions that are moved
by yo
r
L. howbeyt I found him very rawly instructed, & as far as
I rememb
r
hee told mee expressly that hee himself nev
r
sawe
Pedro van Arragon
.
S
r
Edward norris
hath bin lately at
e
Haghe
, & as her Ma
ty
requested by her l
res
for
to
e states
& my
LL.
at home directed mee heer to deal w
th
e Councell
he was admitted to
e Goverment of Oostend, w
th
a generall
good liking aswell of
e states
as
of
e Councel. & for his
entertaynment they have assigned him monethly 40
li
ster
l
to be raised upon
e contribution of Flandres, w
ch
I stand
in great doubt will hardly amount to paie that allowaunce.
Because I was requered by my L of
e Councel to furder this
election of S
r
Edward Norris: I beseech yo
r
L. yf they know yt
not already, to signify unto them what is don in his
cause. I have no awnswer as yet fr
o
e g
na
l states
to o
r
last
positions, nor I see no hast that is made.
still they do p
r
tend that they know not as yet the pleasure
of theyr principals. but yf yt bee so as I am informed, when
theyr pleasure is knowen, yt will hardly deserve
e lingering
attendance. For I am told by my friend
that there is an
awnswere made by thes men heer by waie of a project, & sent
unto
e provinces to be made Authenticall, w
ch
yf yt bee trew ys an
unusall
ceeding, & wholy heer disliked of indyfferent
sons
who cannot bee
swaded that they will not frame any aunswere
to her Hig
nes
content.
To signify unto yo
r
L. what hath passed heer of late in the
exploit
of these Countreys about
e end of Au
g
last
S
r
Francis
Vere
was appointed by
e Councell of state w
th
600 footmen, & 6
cornet
of horse to disassiege
e house of Luttekehorne & strong
fort situat between
Werden
and
Essen
in
e territory of
Rekelinchusen
in
e diocesse of
Collen
, w
ch
was lately surprised by a scottishe
captaine of these Contreys, & p
nt
ly upon yt besieged by
e
Ennemy. the 3
d
of this moneth S
r
Francis came before yt, wher
he found
t
the Enemy had fortified before the entry of
e House.
upon his arrivall 300 of
e Ennemyes assigned for the gard
of theyr trenches retired to
e fort & refusing to yeeld, being
fol.277r
Belgia 1590: Sep
t
.
sommoned, were assualted so valiantly, that after half an howres
fight at hard blowes o
r
souldiers entred
e fort, & put all to
e sworde, wh
r
upon
e house was relieved & besydes some oth
r
small fort
th
r
about
yeelded p
nt
ly of them selves. There were onely
slaine in
e conflict of S
r
Francis troupes 25 & some 40 hurt.
13 daies after retourning toward
Disbourgh
, he assaulted
e fort
of Graef by wesel, a place of importance in the ennemyes
possession: where they yeelded unto him after two assault
&
de
ted w
th
bagg and baggage. To report a trueth unto
yo
r
L. S
r
Francis Vere by his speciall industry & Vertue doth
force this people to love & commend him, wh
r
as othrwise theyr
ingratitude ys so straunge, that they shew very seeldome, at the
best endevours of any of o
r
nation, any loving contentment
while S
r
Francis ys busied in those quarters, yt was resolved
heer at home, that the houses of Hemmart & Heel should
bee beaten w
th
e cannon & assaulted at one instant both
together, for w
ch
cause they have revoked S
r
Francis & assigned
him, & as many companies more as may amount to
e nomb
r
of
4000 to meet w
th
Co. Maurice at
Gorchem
or
Bommel
, where
they are at this p
nt
in hand w
th
theyr enterprise, & have
battered
e fort of Hemmart for 2 daies together, but I
cannot yet und
r
stand that S
r
Francis is come thether. The
Germain Embassado
rs
of whom I have written in a former
letter ar newly de
ted toward
Frankford
. where they meet in a
diet, w
th
e deputies of oth
r
princes to mak a publick
relation of theyr aunswere from hence, wh
r
of the effect is no
oth
r
, but that they are contented heer to deliv
r
up
e fort
of
Luttekehove and Budick ov
r
against Graef aforenamed, w
ch
were al such places as were of late taken from
e Enemy
But for
Zgravenwiert
.
Schink
fort, because
e
states of
Gueldres
p
r
tend a right & propriety to
e place, they require
that there may bee a meeting of Deputyes on both sydes, to
confer upon
e reasons
t
wilbe alleaged by those of Gueldres.
Their awnswere was reputed by
e Embassado
rs
to bee but frivolous
and dilatory. Nev
r
theles such as yt was they could not obtayn
yt, untell they shewed openly theyr great dislike to be
trayned on so long, & p
r
pared th
r
upon to retourne w
th
out an
awnswere, threatening them th
r
tw
th
all w
th
the publick
scription
& band of
e Empire. Heer ys p
nt
newes from the Count
that
e house of Hemmart having endured above 1200 cannon
shot, is come to composition, & the souldiers in it have
fol.227v
To my L. Treasuro
r
21 Sep
t
90.
quitted
e place, so
t
now theyr whole strength is employed against
Heel. There is also fresh adv
r
tisement from S
r
Francis
Vere, who remayneth as yet in
e land of
Cleave
, that
w
th
some furd
r
succo
r
from hence, hee ys in hope to
recover Berck,
e fort of
Rees
, the Beek, & other
places confining. By letters out of
Brabant
yt is
certefyed, that
Co. Mansfield
doth assemble all
e forces
that his garrisons can spare. These advertisement
have
put
both
e states heer &
e concel of state in such a
plexity, as they cannot determine wheth
r
yt will steed
e
Contrey more to pursue
e victory w
th
S
r
Francis Vere, or rath
r
upon this benefyt of having Hemart, to attempt somewhat
upon
Bolduck
, the fort of
Terheid
by
Breda
, &
e
Ennemeyes hold in those quarters, or els to go forward
w
th
theyr former desseyn for making incursyons into Brabant:
w
ch
they are
swaded will prove un
fitable, yf Co.
Mansfelt be bent to encounter theyr forces; What is like to
be resolved I cannot conjecture, but I will certify
yo
r
L. assone as any thing ys offred. & so I take
my humble leave. Hage 21 Sep
t
1590.
